author: nero_eth
content:
I have clarified one small thing in the EIP:
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/10990

As <@261161007982968833> told me, geth (cc <@427903869226582018> ) is checking if the BAL is correct in two stages: (1) check write state diffs from BAL directly with the transaction validation (by comparing the generated state diff during txs execution with the given entries in the BAL) and (2) check state-locations/ reads at the end after they have been accumulating over all transactions.

This fine, and likely more efficient but different from the specs where we generate another BAL during block validation and compare hashes.
To make this optimization secure, clients must check that every BAL_index (tx_id +1) is below `len(transactions) + 2` to avoid suprious BAL entries not being caught during validation (e.g. a suprious entry at `bal_index = len(transactions) +2`).
This was already spec'ed in the EIP but using the `bal_index < len(transactions) +2` rule, clients are safe.
